title: Asparagus with Kumquats and Tarragon
directions: Prepare an ice bath. Line a baking sheet with a clean kitchen towel and set aside. Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil over high heat, add the asparagus and cook until almost tender, about 4 minutes. Drain the asparagus in a colander and immediately transfer them to the ice bath to stop the cooking. When the asparagus are cool, about 1 minute, drain, then transfer them to a towel-lined sheet pan to drain.
In a large bowl, whisk together the kumquats, olive oil, white wine vinegar, green garlic, ginger and salt. Add the asparagus and gently toss so that the vinaigrette coats each spear.
Transfer the asparagus to a platter and garnish with chopped tarragon.
ingredients: 1½ pounds large asparagus, ends trimmed and peeled
½ teaspoon finely minced green garlic (optional)
